channel.title: First Recorded Mix
channel.description:
I just started recording my mixes. Remember that I've only been Djing for a few months, so there's multiple fuck ups within. Just wanting some opinions or if anyone's fairly experienced with mixing, some helpful criticism. Here's my first:
http://www.mixcrate.com/wattamf/first-mix-1-192755
I know it starts off slow with a pretty terrible song. However, it builds up.

item.title: First Recorded Mix
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Tree, post:8, topic:455123”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=557995.msg4083997#msg4083997 date=1345614936]
Tree, come to QLD for schoolies man. Get me girls.
[/quote]

I’m in Europe for most the end of the year.
Then i move to London for two years in March.
Come to perth so we can do fuckall and wish we were in QLD.[/quote]
As tempting as that sounds, already got a 5 star apartment booked right in the middle of Surfers. =)

Read full topic

item.title: First Recorded Mix
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

1.) You play all the shit parts of the songs.
2.) The song selections are WAY to different from each other.
2.) There pretty old, and decently not great a song choice.

All in all, It was alright. Keep working at it. 2 of my mates produce music (House / Trance and HardStyle) and they way theres sounds is so much more ‘real’.

Read full topic

item.title: First Recorded Mix
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:2, topic:455123”]Not bad song choices, didn’t think it was too bad.

Transitions need a bit of work, but that comes with time/practice.

5:30 mistake.[/quote]

Thanks man. Yeah, I’m slowly improving my transitions. A few times there i messed up.

[quote=“bananaman, post:3, topic:455123”]Nice mix man I’m planning on juming onto the DJ’ing scene soon and i have a couple of questions.

  1. How did you learn

  2. What do you think of these decks for a beginner (I don’t wanna do vinyl) http://www.amazon.co.uk/Numark-Mixtrack-Pro-Digital-Controller/dp/B00466HLWO/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1345545731&sr=8-1[/quote]

  3. I had a few useful resources to work with:

  • Youtube videos.
  • Listening to others mix on soundcloud and mixcrate.
  • Knowing what’s fresh by looking up beatports most popular.
  • DJ forums for the theory side.
  • Luckily enough, i know a few great DJs who play at clubs around my city. I sometimes accompany them or ask them when I’m in doubt. The music scene is so supportive.
  1. They’re fine for starting off. Actually, i started off using something even cheaper than that. Your other options is the DDJ-T1 from pioneer. It prepares you for the club standard pioneer decks that most clubs have. It’s one of the better controllers out there. Eventually you will feel limited and want to progress to CDJs which is where I’m at, which forces me to perfect my beatmatching.
Yz85Racer:

Yo waddup this ya boy DJ Tree

[quote=“The Soul, post:5, topic:455123”]++ for Knife Party and Avicii.

thought it was pretty good.[/quote]

Thanks lads

Read full topic
